verses.verse: In the presence of God and of Christ Jesus, who is to judge the living and the dead,[b] and by his appearing and his kingdom, I charge you:
preach the message; be persistent in doing so, whether in season or out of season; convince, reprove, and encourage, but with great patience and instruction.
For the time is coming when people will not accept sound doctrine, but they will follow their own desires and accumulate teachers who will preach to their itching ears.
They will shut their ears to the truth and be captivated by myths.
As for you, always be sober. Endure hardships, do the work of preaching the gospel, and carry out your ministry to the fullest extent.[c]
As for me, I am already being poured out as a libation, and the time has come for my departure.
I have fought the good fight; I have finished the race; I have kept the faith.
Now waiting for me is the crown[e] of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous judge, will award to me on that Day—and not only to me, but to all those who have eagerly longed for his appearance.
Make every effort to come to me as soon as possible.
Because of his love of worldly pursuits, Demas[f] has deserted me and gone off to Thessalonica. Crescens has gone to Galatia, and Titus has left for Dalmatia.
No one but Luke[g] is with me. Get Mark and bring him with you, for he has been helpful to me in my ministry.
I have sent Tychicus[h] to Ephesus.
When you come, bring along with you the cloak[i] that I left with Carpus in Troas, and also the scrolls, particularly the parchments.
Alexander the coppersmith[j] has done me a great deal of harm. The Lord will repay him for his deeds.
Be on guard yourself against him, for he has been strongly opposed to our teaching.
At the first hearing of my case, no one came to court to support me. Every one of them deserted me. May it not be held against them!
But the Lord stood at my side[k] and gave me strength so that through me the message might be fully proclaimed and all the Gentiles might hear it. Thus was I rescued from the lion’s jaws.
The Lord will rescue me from every evil attack and bring me safely into his heavenly kingdom. To him be glory forever and ever. Amen.[l]
Greet Prisca and Aquila,[n] and the household of Onesiphorus.
Erastus[o] remained in Corinth, while I left Trophimus ill in Miletus.
Do your best to get here before winter. Eubulus sends greetings to you, as do Pudens and Linus and Claudia and all the brethren.[p]
The Lord be with your spirit. Grace be with all of you.[q]
